result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Michael Miotke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Michael Miotke

Prior: 2477 S 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Anthony Michael Miotke in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Anthony Michael Miotke in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to D/C 947.01(1).  Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court approves to amend Ct. 1 to D/C 947.01.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended charge.  Atty Frank agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & with full understanding of the consequences.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.

Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail, concurrent to any other sentence
Sentence to commence forthwith
Court Costs = $243.00 + $200.00 DNA Surcharge = $443.00.
Payment Plan:  $25.00/month commencing in July
Credit = 47 days
Plea hearing on April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Michael Miotke in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Anthony Michael Miotke in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in talking with Atty Frank before court, the defendant will be waiving time limits for that Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Hendee states that the parties are close to resolution.
Atty Frank agrees and states that the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim and would like this set for a plea.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  
Set for Plea.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
PETITION FOR LEAVE TO FILE ADDITIONAL MOTIONS
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Anthony Michael Miotke in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Anthony Michael Miotke in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.  
Atty Frank has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today


Atty Frank states that the defendant requests a Prelim and does not waive time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim.  
Time limits were not waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 11:00 am.
